headline.seo: Euro Zone Leaders Under Pressure to Take Action
headline.main: Pressure for Action at Brussels Meeting

docs.snippet: As central bankers and foreign leaders push for a more unified Euro zone banking system, little has changed in the positions of the four European Union leaders that would need to agree on a plan....
docs.abstract: European Union leaders will probably end their upcoming summit meeting in Brussels with promises for a more unified euro zone banking system; however, leaders are not expected to do anything drastic because they have not been able to find a way to break the fundamental deadlock between the northern countries, led by Germany, and southern countries like Spain and Italy and their ally, France.
docs.lead_paragraph: As central bankers and foreign leaders push for a more unified Euro zone banking system, little has changed in the positions of the four European Union leaders that would need to agree on a plan.

headline.print_headline: A Photo Finish Too Close to Call, Even by Camera
headline.seo: 2012 Olympics — A U.S. Berth at Stake, and No Way to Break the Tie
headline.main: A Photo Finish Too Close to Call, Even by Camera

docs.snippet: After Allyson Felix and Jeneba Tarmoh tied for third in the 100 meters, officials decided that the athletes would be given a choice between breaking the tie with a coin toss or a runoff....
docs.abstract: Allyson Felix and Jeneba Tarmoh tie for third place in the 100 meters at the United States Olympic trials; photo finish failed to reveal which woman earned a spot on the United States Olympic track and field team; officials rule that the athletes will be given a choice between breaking the tie with a coin toss or a runoff; if they agree on which option they prefer, that method will be used; if there is a disagreement, a runoff will be held.

byline.contributor: Ken Belson and Mary Pilon contributed reporting from Eugene, Ore.

docs.lead_paragraph: After Allyson Felix and Jeneba Tarmoh tied for third in the 100 meters, officials decided that the athletes would be given a choice between breaking the tie with a coin toss or a runoff.

headline.print_headline: Technology Identifies Lost Color at Roman Forum
headline.seo: Menorah on Arch of Titus in Roman Forum Was Rich Yellow
headline.main: Technology Identifies Lost Color at Roman Forum

docs.snippet: Spectrometry shows that a bas-relief of the menorah looted by Romans from the Second Temple in Jerusalem, on the Arch of Titus in the Roman Forum, was originally a rich yellow....
docs.abstract: Archaeologists determine the original colors of interior reliefs on the Arch of Titus in the Roman Forum using noninvasive spectrometry readings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Spectrometry shows that a bas-relief of the menorah looted by Romans from the Second Temple in Jerusalem, on the Arch of Titus in the Roman Forum, was originally a rich yellow.
